ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gab ngwòŋ Kánàhan tà ńcʉ́me púʼu, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né Yǒonshûa ngie:
en: Then the Lord spoke to Joshua,

ngiemboon: «Tsẅii mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ngie pɔ́ gʉa na metÿǒsoŋ, ńtsɔ́ʼ metÿǒsoŋ lelyěen, páʼ n da tsẅi né Mǒonsê púʼu.
en: “Tell the Israelites: Select your cities of refuge, as I instructed you through Moses,

ngiemboon: É metÿǒsoŋ mie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, à lɔɔn fʉa ńzẅé nyìŋ, á kÿo ńgʉa ńdyeen tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ̌ tàʼ; mɔɔn metÿǒsoŋ ge kẅéte gẅí lélyeen tá ńdɔg ńtsɔgɔ, á mbwó fɛ̌ mpfó gẅie à gẅiin létsɔ́ʼɔ piŋé nò nyìŋ gẅie mé zẅě yé.
en: so that a person who kills someone unintentionally or accidentally may flee there. These will be your refuge from the avenger of blood.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à zẅě nyìŋ ge kÿo, é gʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ̌ tàʼ na metÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́, é kúu ncwò nkáʼa tÿǒsoŋ, é tyé, é píte, éshwóŋ melÿò nò gie à tɔ̌ɔn. Tá pɔ́ leen ńké ńkúe yé; ńnáa jʉʼ gie à ge néŋe wó.
en: When someone flees to one of these cities, stands at the entrance of the city gate, and states his case before the elders of that city, they are to bring him into the city and give him a place to live among them.

ngiemboon: Afɛ̌ mpfó gẅie à gẅiin létsɔ́ʼɔ piŋé nò nyìŋ gẅie mé zẅě yé, à lɔɔn ńjwoŋo nyìŋ gẅie à zẅě nyìŋ tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ, mbà melÿò ŋwɛ́ té náa nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ gẅie à zẅě nyìŋ mbwó yé wɔ́. Ńtí nue à ka zẅé nyìŋ táʼ, á ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉa pwó, mbà à zɔ̌ɔn laa yé pʉ̀a.
en: And if the avenger of blood pursues him, they must not hand the one who committed manslaughter over to him, for he killed his neighbor accidentally and did not hate him beforehand.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à zẅě nyìŋ ge ké láʼ tsẅé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ, tà láʼ tyé mvfò láʼ, mé ŋaga yé, à ké ńgíŋe ńtsẅé pɔ́ wó, tà nùŋepwɔʼ welÿò gẅie yé zɔ lɔ̌ɔn ne faʼa fʉʼó ŋwɛ́ láʼ ńkwé, tá à leen ńké ḿbiŋ nzèm, né ndá ye, á tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ gie à la fó wó ńkÿo.»
en: He is to stay in that city until he stands trial before the assembly and until the death of the high priest serving at that time.   Then the one who committed manslaughter may return home to his own city from which he fled.”

ngiemboon: Mɛ̌ metÿǒsoŋ mie pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ la tsɔ́ʼ páʼ ngwɔ́ mefÿɛ́ kÿo ńdyeen wó, é mɔɔn: yɔɔn laa tÿǒsoŋo Kendɛ́shÿè á Ngalílîa, á tsɛ̀ɛ mekwɛ́ Nɛbtali, yɔɔn gwɔ́ ye kiliyad-Alemba (kiliyad-Alemba gẅie mé gíŋ ńtóŋ lê Embeloŋ), á tsɛ̀ɛ mekwɛ́ Yúndà.
en: So they designated Kedesh in the hill country of Naphtali in Galilee,   Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron) in the hill country of Judah.  # 20:7 Jos 21:11; Lk 1:39

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Juundʉŋ, á shÿó sǎʼnèm Yelíkò, pɔ́ tsɔ́ʼɔ tÿǒsoŋo Mbetsɛ̂ɛ á jʉʼ gie á saŋte á nkùɔmekwaʼá, á jʉʼ gie á laa ye pʉ̀a na ngẅɛ̀te Lẅímbèŋ, pɔ́ ngẅɛ̀te Lamɔd á jʉʼ gie áa Ngalad, ńgwɔ́ ye ngẅɛ̀te Ngâd; ńgíŋ ńgÿo Ngolaŋ, á jʉʼ gie áa Mbashÿaŋ, ńgwɔ́ ye ngẅɛ̀te Manase.
en: Across the Jordan east of Jericho, they selected Bezer on the wilderness plateau from Reuben’s tribe, Ramoth in Gilead from Gad’s tribe, and Golan in Bashan from Manasseh’s tribe.

ngiemboon: Mé la tsɔ́ʼ mɔɔn metÿǒsoŋ légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ntsèm tà mbɔɔ pakÿoláʼ pie é tsẅé láʼ pɔ́b, é lɔɔn fʉa ńzẅé nyìŋ, pɔ́ kÿo ńgʉa ńdyeen wó. Ńzsé ngie afɛ̌ mpfó gẅie à gẅiin létsɔ́ʼɔ piŋé nò nyìŋ gẅie mé zẅě yé, à te zẅé nyìŋ gẅie à zẅě nyìŋ ŋwɛ̌, té gwɔ́ gie à tyě mvfò láʼ tà mé ŋaga yé wɔ́.
en: These are the cities appointed for all the Israelites and the aliens residing among them,   so that anyone who kills a person unintentionally may flee there and not die at the hand of the avenger of blood until he stands before the assembly.
